name: Courtyard by Marriott New Braunfels River Village

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Checked in for one night after flying into Austin. Was ever only intended to be a brief pitstop to kick off our week's trip.
reviews.title: Functional corporate hotel with a slice of style

reviews.text: Just off the highway but a nice looking place. Our room which looked out over the river had two large beds...perfect for sleeping off the jet lag. Good breakfast the next day to set us up for the day. Attractive decking walkways at the back of the hotel and a pool.
reviews.title: Gorgeous & relaxing, rooms are spacious & well thought out.
Beautiful place, poorly managed
reviews.text: Wouldn't suit us for more than a night or two but surprisingly decent and spacious hotel which probably fares well with the business trade.

Only got to stay one night for a girls weekend but this all new hotel is outstanding. Very attentive staff at check-in AND check-out. Beautifully decorated room, well situated with separate bar area for coffee & mini-fridge. Balcony allows a quiet spot for coffee in the morning while enjoying a great view of the river & many large, old pecan trees. Squirrels playing near the river & ducks, too. Jacuzzi & nice pool, large deck with chairs & tables & even a fire pit with chairs for cool nights. I understand this is less than 5 mi from Schlitterbahn & very close to go tubing. We spent time in Gruene shopping & enjoying local food. We'll be back!!!
reviews.title: Very disappointing experience

reviews.text: First the good... this is indeed a beautiful, new property, in a gorgeous setting. The rooms are well-furnished and comfortable. Some of the desk personnel were very helpful, especially the young woman who was manning the front desk on the afternoon of 3/18/2010, who did the best she could and remained polite and resourceful in a very difficult situation
reviews.title: Great Value! Wonderful Experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Extremely disappoint. We went for a wedding party, stuff were stolen from our room and our friend's room. Don't forget anything at all in your room, it will disappear. Front desk won't be any helpful either.
reviews.title: Thieves Ridden Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed for business, but this is an extremely beautiful and unique hotel. Literally you can walk down and get in the river if you want to . I was there for business so I did not try it, but I wanted to. Also the pool overlooks the river.
reviews.title: Spectacular Hotel

reviews.text: I will go back for leisure.
reviews.title: Very nice new hotel

reviews.text: Loved the hotel setting... doesn't feel like your typical hotel when sitting outside taking in the atmosphere. The housekeeping could take some steps to make things better. Any other hotel chain we've stayed in always wipes out the bathtub and bathroom floor, not this one. It hadn't been touched. The dirty silverware & dishes from take-out (The Bistro) were not picked up! We even tipped this housekeeper ... but that didn't get us a "clean" room. It did get us fresh towels and made up beds. This isn't a deal breaker. The hotel is very nice and beds are very comfy. There is a teeny-tiny fridge in the room but NO microwave. The Bistro is expensive.
reviews.title: Beautiful property, very nice hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here with my family over fourth of July weekend. It was the first weekend they were open, and we had a fabulous stay. The staff was very courteous, the rooms were clean and very nicely decorated! The property is really breathtaking....it was July in Texas, and the trees kept it so breezy and cool while at the pool...the view around the pool is just gorgeous. Most of all, the location is fantastic. You are mere minutes away from Landa Falls (a must with the kiddos), Gruene Hall, and the outlet malls (which I must say have become so very, very nice...lots of high end shopping at great prices)! We couldn't say enough nice things about it....a must see!
reviews.title: Lots of issues

reviews.text: I would stya here again. I attended a modest sized conference (300) held here. The meeting facilities were wonderful. The piiza in the restaurant was good. I did have a problem with being charged $5 too much for my meal at teh restaurant but the manager took it off when I mentioned it.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in New Braunfels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first visit to New Braunfels (we came for a concert at Gruene Hall) and I suspect that very few of the chain hotels along the freeway have such a nice setting. Behind the hotel is a vast garden space with pool, numerous decks, and the river. Even though it was winter, you could sit in the sun in a comfortable chair and enjoy the view. At night it is nice too, especially if a little warmer than the 38 degrees we had.
reviews.title: Lovely Setting on the Guadalupe River

reviews.text: We thought the room was very complete and quite alright. There is nothing like an all new property. Nice to have a couch opposite the TV and the walk-in shower is a very good trend. Some rooms have their own decks, but we went for the lower priced option.
reviews.title: Fabulous location & Great service!

reviews.text: The hotel was quiet, and actually pretty empty. Maybe it was the N Y's eve lull. There was a wedding the night we stayed there, and you can see they are trying for this market.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel! The staff is amazing and the hotel is cozy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is fun to see how the big operations try to re-invent the lobby:
reviews.title: resort atmosphere; serene river setting; Texas Hills hospitality;

reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights at this hotel. It had just opened 2 weeks before. It has a beautiful setting on the river. Everything about this hotel is just great!
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay!

reviews.text: I am so very impressed with this new Courtyard in New Braunfels. The rooms were clean, staff very courteous and friendly. Most impressive is the property. The pool is great, underneath big cypress trees. The property has a view of the river and a huge fire pit for winter months. Easy access to everything in New Braunfels. I could just go on and on. Perfect stay and I can't wait to go back.
reviews.title: Very Impressed

reviews.text: New, trendy hotel right off I-35 which backs up to the river and is nestled in the trees. Modern design lobby and rooms, nIce outdoor patio area with pool and hot tub. My family really enjoyed staying there. Only negative was that is was not quite finished being built out by the river, the pool was a little small for the size of the hotel and i am not sure what they were thinking when they put up the Marriott sign off the feeder road. It's completely blocked from site by the trees. Other than those minor details it was a nice stay.
reviews.title: Marriott Riverside Village

reviews.text: The hotels is extremely nice and in a very good location. We had a room with a balcony that over looked the pool and the river. Our room was really small (king with a sofa bed) I got to look in some of the other rooms and there were bigger rooms. I think I would have rather stayed in a bigger room and give up the balcony. The hotel lobby is wide open with lots of seating and flat screen tvs. The eating area in the bistro has individual booths that seat 4 -6 and each booth has its own tv. Very nice. The decor is very earthy and modern. Very beautiful. The only problem I had was at check in--you could not check in until 3. The had no clue if any of the rooms were clean. The manager finally started walking up and physically checking to see what rooms were clean to let us check in. Then when we did get to our room I had to ask the cleaning lady to re-clean my bathroom floor. It looked dirty and I found hair. She was happy to oblige. The pool was very small. We swam the first night and around 8 it got really crowded with about 20 people. It would have been really nice if they would have made a larger pool. It's ashame because the setting is so beautiful with the large pecan trees and river and then they put this dinky small pool. They were having problem with the pool I would imagine due to the many people swimming. The next day they had clorine floating devices like you would buy at Walmart. The water was extremely cloudy. I didn't let my kids swim that day. By the next day the water was looking better. Management said the water was fine to swim in. I wasn't so sure about that. Over all this is a really nice hotel and I would definitely stay here again. I am sure they just need to work out the kinks with a new staff and training. If you are traveling with small children Landa Park is a must. My 3 year old loved it there and the springfed pool with the waterslide is awesome!!! In the back of the park they have a springfed wading pool. It's beautiful and they have a train that you can ride throughout the park. Don't forget Aquarena Springs with the glassbottom boat ride. There is so much to do in the area that is so close by. We also did the NaturalBridge Caverns. That was fun but beware of the climb up--It's a workout! Incase you are wondering--you can not get in the river from the hotel. The water looks pretty deep there and it has not been manacured yet. I would imagine over time they will fix all of this up. There were no walkways put in yet either. Also, there is an outdoor firelplace that I imagine will be really nice during the winter months. Hoped this review helped!!
reviews.title: Very nice-just need to work out the kinks

reviews.text: We have stayed at many Courtyard's and this is one of the best. Excellent service throughout our stay. Great location, right on the river, and everything you need is just minutes away. This is a brand new hotel so the rooms were immaculate. Great pool area with nice patios over looking the river. Overall, a great stay during the 4th of July weekend.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
